title: What led to Cleopatra’s fall as the ruler of Egypt? - Quora

response.answer_text: Octavius or emperor Augustus, the nephew of Julius Caesar and brother-in-law (or former) Mark Anthony. Mark Anthony was willing to team up with Cleopatra to claiming half of Roman empire to Egypt and starting a Dynasty with Caesar"s son with Cleopatra, Caesarian. A son of the very revered emperor and the Queen of the richest country in the world and head priestess of the widley population religion was simply unstoppable from legitimacy point of view of both Romans and Egyptians. Emperor Augustus ruined Mark Anthony and Cleopatra's plan by defeating them in a decisive naval battle at Actium.
